content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-156-11-B
|Item_parent=Infections in the bones and joints (IOA) of children and adults
|Item_parent_short=Infections osteo articulaires (IOA) de l'enfant et de l'adulte
|Rank=B
|Title=Knowing the complications of acute septic arthritis
|Description=None
|Topic=Follow-up and/or prognosis
|Contributors=Dr Florent Valour
|Order=11}}
- Sepsis, septic shock

- Abscesses of adjacent soft tissue

- Contiguous osteitis

- Joint destruction with functional sequelae

- Linked to bacteremia: infective endocarditis, other secondary localizations

question.question: What are potential complications of acute septic arthritis?
question.option_a: Sepsis, septic shock, and abscesses of adjacent soft tissue
question.option_b: Contiguous osteitis, joint destruction with functional sequelae, and linked to bacteremia
question.option_c: Infective endocarditis, other secondary localizations, and sepsis
question.option_d: Abscesses of adjacent soft tissue, joint destruction with functional sequelae, and linked to bacteremia
